verses.roman:
adya niṣkauravāṁ pṛthvīṁ
kariṣyāmīty amarṣitaḥ
gṛhītvā halam uttasthau
dahann iva jagat-trayam

synonyms: adya—today; pṛthvīm—the earth; kariṣyāmi—I shall make; iti—thus speaking; amarṣitaḥ—angry; gṛhītvā—taking; halam—His plow; uttasthau—He stood; dahan—burning; iva—as if; jagat—the worlds; trayam—three.
translation: "Today I shall rid the earth of the Kauravas!" declared the furious Balarāma. Thus He took His plow weapon and rose up as if to set the three worlds ablaze.
